column4: I hope somebody can help me so i'll outline my problem in short :)
I'm on WLAN at an 16 Mbit connection, and apt download speed is very good about ~1,8 Mb/s
But browsing is insanely slow (Firefox and Opera), sites do either load very slowly or i just get an error
also tracepath www.google.de aborts after the server of the ISP
What can i do? :)
no, how?
long wait before loading starts (if loading starts)
and sometimes a very fast error
(but only in opera)
but if it's a dns-problem, shouldn't the same problem appear on windows?
Change the settings to ignore IPv6, restart the connection, see if that helps.
Add in another DNS server that's not in your country - like 139.130.4.5
You can also change the MTU to 1500 instead of "automatic" - I find that helps heaps.
Have you made sure you turned off proxy auto-configuration in your web browser?
yes it's turned off
If everything else works fast (or appears to) - have you tried more than one browser?
I tried Opera and Firefox
I think you can get away with that.
Workin?
Have you tried, in gconf-editor: /system/http_proxy => check the settings (or delete them)
thanks I'll try
